prompts.system_prompt: You are an open IE extractor operating under a fixed ontology. From the text, propose triples [subject, relation, object] that satisfy the ontology’s domain→range. For every triple, cite exact supporting span(s) and give a 0–1 confidence. Output JSON only.
prompts.user_prompt:
Task: Extract up to k triples that are directly supported by the text. You may paraphrase, but you must quote the evidence substrings.

    Requirements
    - Extract triples [subject, relation, object] that are explicitly supported by the text.
    - For any triple that instantiates an ontology relation (i.e., its relation label appears in the ontology),
      enforce domain→range consistency: the subject_type must match the relation’s domain concept, and
      the object_type must match the relation’s range concept.
    - You may also output factual triples that do NOT correspond to any ontology relation; in that case,
      choose the most appropriate subject_type and object_type concept labels from the ontology, but do not discard the triple.
    - Return JSON only, with this schema
        {
          "triples": [
            {
              "triple": ["subject","relation","object"],
              "subject_type": "Concept",
              "object_type": "Concept",
              "support": "exact quote from text",
              "confidence": 0.0
            }
          ]
        }
    - The confidence must be a real value between 0 and 1, estimated by how clearly the text supports the triple,
      and how well subject_type and object_type match the ontology types.



One-shot EXAMPLE (for guidance; do not copy the text):
Example sentence:
"The ALCO RS-3 has a four-stroke engine, a diesel-electric transmission and is 17068.8 millimetres in length. The ALCO RS-3 was produced between May 1950 and August 1956."

Example triples (bare triples just to show what facts should emerge):
[["ALCO RS-3", "buildDate", "May 1950 - August 1956"], ["ALCO RS-3", "engine", "Four-stroke engine"], ["ALCO RS-3", "powerType", "Diesel-electric transmission"], ["ALCO RS-3", "length", "17068.8 (millimetres)"]]

NOTE:
- The example triples above are simplified bare triples.
- YOUR OUTPUT MUST follow the full schema described below
  (with subject_type, object_type, support, and confidence in [0,1]).
- Do not copy the example text; extract from the actual Text section only.

    Text
    "The German built A-Rosa Luna is powered by a MTU Friedrichshafen engine which is made in Friedrichshafen."

    Ontology concepts
    MeanOfTransportation, Company, Organisation, Place, Country, City, Function, Ship, ShipClass, Product, PowerType, BodyStyle, Wheelbase, Class, Airport, Flight, Date, Year, Fate

    Ontology relations (domain → range)
    - launchSite(MeanOfTransportation,Place)
- location(MeanOfTransportation,Place)
- assembly(MeanOfTransportation,Place)
- country(MeanOfTransportation,Country)
- city(MeanOfTransportation,City)
- countryOrigin(MeanOfTransportation,Country)
- manufacturer(MeanOfTransportation,Company)
- builder(MeanOfTransportation,Company)
- designCompany(MeanOfTransportation,Company)
- operator(MeanOfTransportation,Organisation)
- function(MeanOfTransportation,Function)
- powerType(MeanOfTransportation,PowerType)
- class(MeanOfTransportation,Class)

- wheelbase(MeanOfTransportation,Wheelbase)
- length(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- diameter(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- topSpeed(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- cylinderCount(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- engine(MeanOfTransportation,string)
- transmission(MeanOfTransportation,string)
- status(MeanOfTransportation,string)
- shipClass(MeanOfTransportation,ShipClass)
- shipDraft(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- shipDisplacement(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- shipBeam(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- fate(MeanOfTransportation,Fate)
- relatedMeanOfTransportation(MeanOfTransportation,MeanOfTransportation)
- comparable(MeanOfTransportation,MeanOfTransportation)
- successor(MeanOfTransportation,MeanOfTransportation)
- totalProduction(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- failedLaunches(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- totalLaunches(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- rocketStages(MeanOfTransportation,number)
- modelYears(MeanOfTransportation,number)

- maidenVoyage(MeanOfTransportation,Date)
- maidenFlight(MeanOfTransportation,Date)
- finalFlight(MeanOfTransportation,Date)
- extinctionDate(MeanOfTransportation,Date)

- productionStartYear(MeanOfTransportation,Year)
- productionEndYear(MeanOfTransportation,Year)
- product(Company,Product)
- parentCompany(Company,Company)
- foundationPlace(Company,Place)
- keyPerson(Company,Person)
- foundedBy(Company,Person)

    Constraints
    - Extract ALL clearly stated factual triples in the text (not just those that match ontology relations).
    - Do not discard a triple solely because it does not match any ontology relation; instead,
      assign the best-fitting subject_type and object_type concepts you can infer from the ontology.
    - For triples whose relation label appears in the ontology, respect the domain and range for subject_type and object_type.
    - Always extract any explicit date, time, or year mentioned in the text as part of a factual triple when relevant.
    - Resolve pronouns to the nearest valid antecedent if needed to form a correct triple.
    - Do not invent entities that are not mentioned in the text.
    - Output MUST be valid JSON and nothing else.
